text: Home Home About LaToya About LaToya Children and Families First Healthcare Education Children and Families First Healthcare Healthcare Education Education Press Press Campaign Store Campaign Store Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Access and Protection: Reshaping Healthcare in Wisconsin Health care is a fundamental human right, yet profits and politics are too often prioritized over people. I support reproductive freedom and know access to healthcare leads to healthy kids, families and seniors. My career began in healthcare and my family ran a home healthcare service for many years. In fact, I studied nursing at Alverno College, in Milwaukee, until I suffered a career ending injury. As a person with a disability, I will never stop pushing for quality healthcare. I will continue to increase healthcare access to underserved communities. Increased Healthcare Access Ensuring women and other oppressed groups have access to quality healthcare Expanding access to mental health services Emergency and crisis care for children and families Funding for hospitals and trauma care in rural and other undeserved areas Protecting Reproductive Freedom Contraception and fertility services Reproductive and prenatal care LaToya Bates for Wisconsin State Assembly The Change Wisconsin Deserves Support the Campaign Subscribe to receive emails and campaign information. Home Home About LaToya About LaToya Children and Families First Healthcare Education Children and Families First Healthcare Healthcare Education Education Press Press Campaign Store Campaign Store Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Putting Children First We can all agree that affordable childcare, safe schools where our kids can learn and quality healthcare keep our families strong. Protecting our environment and ensuring we have clean food and water seems common sense. These are the things Wisconsin needs and what I’ll fight for in our state assembly. Lowering Costs for Families Affordable childcare is essential for families and our growing economy. Parents families are struggling to pay for the childcare they need to go to work. Families are suffering and businesses are struggling to have a reliable workforce. Money was put in our state budget to support childcare costs but legislators haven’t considered childcare a priority. I am a mom and I know it is. My family paid $320 each week for childcare. After paying bills, we could barely afford a sandwich for lunch. I will work to lower costs and make sure childcare workers earn the livable wage they deserve. This is not only possible, it is what we owe taxpayers. LaToya Bates for Wisconsin State Assembly The Change Wisconsin Deserves Support the Campaign Subscribe to receive emails and campaign information. Home Home About LaToya About LaToya Children and Families First Healthcare Education Children and Families First Healthcare Healthcare Education Education Press Press Campaign Store Campaign Store Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Investing in Education I went to private school from kindergarten through fifth grade. We couldn’t afford it, but my Nana insisted. My school was small and struggled, ultimately closing when I was in the sixth grade. I am still friends with my class from Holy Redeemer Catholic School. Public school was different. Also hard at times. I had teachers in middle and high school that truly changed my life. I still remember Mrs. Kincaid, Ms. Foley and others who gave me guidance and protection. I understand the value of private schools, especially for the faith community. I do not understand letting private education bankrupt our public schools. Letting neighborhood schools struggle and making taxpayers pay more with referendums is unacceptable. We have to change our funding formula and focus on our public education. K-12 Students Changing the funding formula to protect public education Expanding Head Start and other early childhood educational programs in underserved communities Funding special education Increasing classroom support for teachers Reducing class sizes Increased STEAM classes and resources Empowering educators to make classroom decisions For Secondary and Adult Learners Jobs for our high school and college graduates Expanding the pipeline to college with investments in public education and technical schools LaToya Bates for Wisconsin State Assembly The Change Wisconsin Deserves Support the Campaign Subscribe to receive emails and campaign information. Home Home About LaToya About LaToya Children and Families First Healthcare Education Children and Families First Healthcare Healthcare Education Education Press Press Campaign Store Campaign Store Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution LaToya Bates for District 37 Welcome and thank you for visiting our site. District 37 includes part of Columbia County, Northern Dodge and Southern Fond du Lac Counties. I’ve been meeting people across the state and getting to know what matters most to folks in the district. My Story At the end of the day, I’m just a mom. An average person wanting more for Wisconsin and more from our elected officials. My Papa was a wartime vet, so I grew up surrounded by politics. He and my Nana taught me the power of my vote, so I know the value of yours. In 2024, I decided to stop waiting for other people to make things better and committed to doing more. I ran for Wisconsin State Assembly and became more active in local government. Our campaign had many successes, but I was not elected. I planned to run in 2026 because I had little faith we’d see the change we were promised during the election season. 2025 started with chaos and more party politics then before while Wisconsin suffers. This is why I am starting my campaign for state assembly now. I’m a Wisconsin native, fighting for women, families and small businesses. I will be a voice for the people in office. 2024 Endorsements Distinctions Earned National Democratic Redistricting Committee LaToya Bates for Wisconsin State Assembly The Change Wisconsin Deserves Support the Campaign Subscribe to receive emails and campaign information. Home Home About LaToya About LaToya Children and Families First Healthcare Education Children and Families First Healthcare Healthcare Education Education Press Press Campaign Store Campaign Store Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Empowering Through Education and Opportunities I went to Alverno College directly after high school and where I majored in Nursing with a Business Management Support. A a work related injury ended my nursing career. I changed my major and earned a Bachelor of Arts in Business and Management with Adult Education and Psychology supports. I decided to work in healthcare administration and found training and developing staff to satisfy my desire to teach and be part of the nursing care team. Just before graduation, Zoreh Emami, my International Economics instructor at Alverno, asked a question that changed my life. She asked our class what we, as educated women, would do to other women . This sent me on an unexpected path to be a difference in the world and laid the foundation for my work with women and girls. Alverno College, Extraordinary Women in the Community, 2021 Helping Other Women Directly after college, I became a Probation and Parole Agent for the State of Wisconsin Department of Corrections. I was a Female Offender Specialist and worked with women and battery cases. I was going to make a difference, this seemed a great place to start. Around this time, and in answer to Zoreh’s question, I founded Wounded Wings: Association for the Betterment of Women and Girls. Wounded Wings serves survivors of sexual and domestic abuse and also supports women entrepreneurs. After a few years with Wounded Wings, I returned to Alverno to enhance my skills to become a better leader. I earned a Master’s in Education with an emphasis on Organizational Development. My studies later studies included a Master of Arts in Counseling at Lakeland College. Social Entrepreneurship and Faith I am the owner and manager of Lauryn Wynter Company, an event management group that plans corporate and social events, including the Whitefish Bay Farmers Market. In 2019, I earned a Master’s of the Arts in Pastoral Studies at Cardinal Stritch University . While my earlier degrees were for career pursuits, this one was for God. My time at Stritch helped me to evolve as a Christian and develop an inclusive view of faith and religion. Working for Wisconsin I am a graduate of The White House Project , a non-partisan group training women to run for office. I am a lifelong Democrat, but independent voter. I don’t support party politics and . While too young to vote, I helped to get out the vote for President Clinton’s first Presidential Election. I have actively canvassed and supported candidates ever since. I was honored to represent Dodge County as a delegate at state convention. I also represented the 6 th Congressional District at the Democratic National Convention in 2024. Since this time, I have become the Co-Chair of the Democratic Party of Dodge County . I am also Co-Chair of the Disability Caucus . LaToya Bates for Wisconsin State Assembly The Change Wisconsin Deserves Support the Campaign Subscribe to receive emails and campaign information. Home Home About LaToya About LaToya Children and Families First Healthcare Education Children and Families First Healthcare Healthcare Education Education Press Press Campaign Store Campaign Store Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Donate Make a one-time or recurring campaign contribution Empowering Through Education and Opportunities I went to Alverno College directly after high school and where I majored in Nursing with a Business Management Support. A a work related injury ended my nursing career. I changed my major and earned a Bachelor of Arts in Business and Management with Adult Education and Psychology supports. I decided to work in healthcare administration and found training and developing staff to satisfy my desire to teach and be part of the nursing care team. Just before graduation, Zoreh Emami, my International Economics instructor at Alverno, asked a question that changed my life. She asked our class what we, as educated women, would do to other women . This sent me on an unexpected path to be a difference in the world and laid the foundation for my work with women and girls. Alverno College, Extraordinary Women in the Community, 2021 Helping Other Women Directly after college, I became a Probation and Parole Agent for the State of Wisconsin Department of Corrections. I was a Female Offender Specialist and worked with women and battery cases. I was going to make a difference, this seemed a great place to start. Around this time, and in answer to Zoreh’s question, I founded Wounded Wings: Association for the Betterment of Women and Girls. Wounded Wings serves survivors of sexual and domestic abuse and also supports women entrepreneurs. After a few years with Wounded Wings, I returned to Alverno to enhance my skills to become a better leader. I earned a Master’s in Education with an emphasis on Organizational Development. My studies later studies included a Master of Arts in Counseling at Lakeland College. Social Entrepreneurship and Faith I am the owner and manager of Lauryn Wynter Company, an event management group that plans corporate and social events, including the Whitefish Bay Farmers Market. In 2019, I earned a Master’s of the Arts in Pastoral Studies at Cardinal Stritch University . While my earlier degrees were for career pursuits, this one was for God. My time at Stritch helped me to evolve as a Christian and develop an inclusive view of faith and religion. Working for Wisconsin I am a graduate of The White House Project , a non-partisan group training women to run for office. I am a lifelong Democrat, but independent voter. I don’t support party politics and . While too young to vote, I helped to get out the vote for President Clinton’s first Presidential Election. I have actively canvassed and supported candidates ever since. I was honored to represent Dodge County as a delegate at state convention. I also represented the 6 th Congressional District at the Democratic National Convention in 2024. Since this time, I have become the Co-Chair of the Democratic Party of Dodge County . I am also Co-Chair of the Disability Caucus . LaToya Bates for Wisconsin State Assembly The Change Wisconsin Deserves Support the Campaign Subscribe to receive emails and campaign information. Skip to content District 28 [email protected] [email protected] 7182834916 Facebook Facebook Instagram Instagram Open Button LeGrand For City Council Endorsements Get Involved Contact Us Privacy Policy Close Button Volunteer Privacy Policy Website Privacy Policy This privacy policy (“policy”) will help you understand how LeGrandforthepeople.com (“us”, “we”, “our”) uses and protects the data you provide to us when you visit and use [blog URL] (“blog”, “service”). We reserve the right to change this policy at any given time, of which you will be promptly updated. If you want to make sure that you are up to date with the latest changes, we advise you to frequently visit this page. What User Data We Collect When you visit the blog, we may collect the following data: Your IP address. Your contact information and email address. Other information such as interests and preferences. Data profile regarding your online behavior on our blog. Why We Collect Your Data We are collecting your data for several reasons: To better understand your needs. To improve our services and products. To send you promotional emails containing the information we think you will find interesting. To contact you to fill out surveys and participate in other types of market research. To customize our blog according to your online behavior and personal preferences. Safeguarding and Securing the Data LeGrandforthePeople.com is committed to securing your data and keeping it confidential. LeGrandforthePeople.com has done all in its power to prevent data theft, unauthorized access, and disclosure by implementing the latest technologies and software, which help us safeguard all the information we collect online. Our Cookie Policy Once you agree to allow our blog to use cookies, you also agree to use the data it collects regarding your online behavior (analyze web traffic, web pages you visit and spend the most time on). The data we collect by using cookies is used to customize our blog to your needs. After we use the data for statistical analysis, the data is completely removed from our systems. Please note that cookies don’t allow us to gain control of your computer in any way. They are strictly used to monitor which pages you find useful and which you do not so that we can provide a better experience for you. If you want to disable cookies, you can do it by accessing the settings of your internet browser. You can visit https://www.internetcookies.com , which contains comprehensive information on how to do this on a wide variety of browsers and devices. Links to Other Websites Our blog contains links that lead to other websites. If you click on these links LeGrandforthePeople.com is not held responsible for your data and privacy protection. Visiting those websites is not governed by this privacy policy agreement. Make sure to read the privacy policy documentation of the website you go to from our website. Restricting the Collection of your Personal Data At some point, you might wish to restrict the use and collection of your personal data. You can achieve this by doing the following: When you are filling the forms on the blog, make sure to check if there is a box which you can leave unchecked, if you don’t want to disclose your personal information. If you have already agreed to share your information with us, feel free to contact us via email and we will be more than happy to change this for you. LeGrandforthePeople.com will not lease, sell or distribute your personal information to any third parties, unless we have your permission. We might do so if the law forces us. Your personal information will be used when we need to send you promotional materials if you agree to this privacy policy.
